title: De Cive; Or, Philosophicall Rudiments Concerning Government and Society
sourceDesc: [De Cive] was first published in Latin in 1642, and then published in English in 1651, as [Philosophicall Rudiments Concerning Government and Society]. Our copytext is this first English edition. Though the first to be published, it was destined to become the last of a three-part set. Part one, [De Corpore], was published in 1655, followed by part two, [De Homine], in 1658. Both of these were in Latin; Hobbes never published [De Homine] in English, but an English version of [De Corpore] appeared in 1656, as [The Elements of Philosophy, The First Section, Concerning Body].
author: Thomas Hobbes
